Daily Example (Morning)
	â€¢	Kettlebell swings: start 4 x 15 â†’ progress to 4 x 17
	â€¢	Goblet squats: start 4 x 12 â†’ progress to 5 x 12
	â€¢	Kettlebell rows: start 3 x 10 each arm â†’ progress to 4 x 10
	â€¢	Overhead press: start 3 x 8 â†’ progress to 3 x 10
	â€¢	Forearm curls: start 3 x 12 â†’ maintain or add 1 set if desired

â¸»

Daily Example (Evening)
	â€¢	Planks: start 3 x 20s â†’ progress to 3 x 40s (or easier variation)
	â€¢	Halos: start 3 x 10 â†’ maintain or increase reps if easy
	â€¢	Hip hinges: start 3 x 12 â†’ maintain or increase reps slowly
	â€¢	Press-ups: start 3 x 10 â†’ progress to 3 x 15

â¸»

Key Tips
	â€¢	Track your reps, sets, and time for planks each day
	â€¢	Prioritize form over quantity, especially for swings and overhead press
	â€¢	Rest 30â€“60 seconds between sets
	â€¢	Adjust plank difficulty if needed to avoid burnout
	â€¢	Celebrate small wins weekly

cards.desc:
### Overall Summary
- The creation of a dyslexia assessment app was a spontaneous project initiated after discussing needs with a family member working with dyslexic children.
- The app is a simple platform designed for assessments, including toggles for features, and was successfully deployed using Versailles v0.
- There is a consideration for further development and additional features like text toggles and possibly a dark mode.

### Key Questions/Ponderings
- What additional features or improvements can be added to enhance the app?
- How can the app further assist those with dyslexia beyond the current capabilities?

### Suggested Goal(s)
- Enhance the functionality and usability of the dyslexia assessment platform.
- Explore and implement additional features to cater to users' needs more effectively.

### Actionable Tasks
- Develop and implement additional feature toggles, such as text customization and dark mode.
- Gather user feedback to identify potential improvements and additional feature needs.
- Explore additional deployment options or software tools to improve the app's functionality.
cards.name: Dislexia App

cards.name: 3H First Build

cards.desc:
### Overall Summary
- The user is developing a prompt management tool that features easy selection and customization of prompts, akin to a MIDI board.
- The goal is to create a user-friendly interface that allows for quick access to personalized prompts.
- The user has completed initial iterations using v0, connected to OpenAI for transcription and analysis.
- Challenges experienced include the layout design, needing a mobile-first approach and difficulties with tool stability on different devices.
- The process involves using platforms such as Replit, v0, Supabase, and GitHub for development and integration.
- The user experiences issues with Supabase's free plan and is resolving integration between different tools.
- Uncertainty exists regarding the deployment and database integration process.

### Key Questions/Ponderings
- How can the layout be improved to be more intuitive and visually accessible, particularly on mobile devices?
- Can Supabase's limitations be worked around effectively in this project?
- How to better manage database integration and deployment within existing constraints?

### Suggested Goal(s)
- Develop a fully functional, user-friendly prompt management tool optimized for mobile use.
- Ensure seamless integration with OpenAI and possibly other APIs for enhanced functionality.
- Resolve current integration and database management issues to streamline development.

### Actionable Tasks
- Redesign the layout to be more mobile-friendly.
- Investigate and resolve Supabase limitations or consider alternative database solutions.
- Complete integration with GitHub for version control and broader collaboration.
- Continuously test and iterate the tool across different platforms to ensure stability and usability.
cards.name: Version 2 - better layout

cards.desc:
### Overall Summary
- The main challenge is keeping data updated in an inventory management tool.
- The original focus was on UI and interactions, rather than data updating.
- The system currently relies on manual updates via a spreadsheet shared on WhatsApp.
- The application needs to ingest Excel files and update data automatically, but this feature is not fully functional.
- There is a consideration of whether to adjust the existing system or find a better solution for data ingestion.

### Key Questions/Ponderings
- How can the existing system be modified to update data more effectively?
- Is there a more efficient method to manage data ingestion from Excel files?
- Should Excel data be converted into another format for easier processing?
- Could leveraging Repl.it and its assistance on the code base solve these issues?

### Suggested Goal(s)
- Achieve seamless data integration and updating in the inventory management tool.

### Actionable Tasks
- Review and debug the existing code for data ingestion and updating.
- Consider downloading the code from Repl.it for further analysis and adjustments.
- Explore alternative methods or formats for data ingestion to improve efficiency.
- Utilize Repl.it's assistance to solve coding challenges related to the project.
- Decide on the best solution for converting and ingesting Excel data into the tool.
cards.name: HMW keep the data updated

cards.desc:
### Overall Summary
- The user is working on a FinTech project and needs UI design work done.
- They have found a designer on Upwork named Tej who is ready to start.
- The project is delayed due to the company's accounting issues, requiring a 1-2 week pause.
- The user needs to communicate with Tej about the delay and offer to share some files for preliminary review without initiating full work yet.

### Key Questions/Ponderings
- How long will the company's accounting issues take to resolve?
- What exactly needs to be communicated to Tej to maintain a good working relationship?

### Suggested Goal(s)
- Successfully communicate the project delay and provide interim support or information to the designer.
- Ensure readiness to start the project as soon as the company resolves its accounting issues.

### Actionable Tasks
- Compose and send a message to Tej explaining the situation with apologies for the delay.
- Offer to share preliminary files with Tej for review without formally starting the design work.
cards.name: Update Tejj

cards.desc: FYI, according to Devs KYC is already done and they want designs for the next section instead.
cards.name: Second Meeting

cards.desc:
### Overall Summary
- The text discusses the speaker's consideration of getting a gift for Auntie Runka after missing her birthday on the weekend.
- The speaker is contemplating buying a voucher for a deep tissue massage, knowing that Auntie Runka enjoys them and is currently very stressed.

### Key Questions/Ponderings
- What is a suitable amount for a massage voucher that Auntie Runka would appreciate?
- Are there any specific massage parlors she prefers or would benefit from more?
- Is there an alternative gift that could be equally appreciated?

### Suggested Goal(s)
- To purchase a meaningful and stress-relieving gift for Auntie Runka.

### Actionable Tasks
- Research local deep tissue massage services and their pricing.
- Purchase a voucher for a reputable deep tissue massage therapist or spa.
- Consider other stress-relief gifts if needed.
cards.name: AR Bday Sunday

cards.desc:
### Overall Summary
- The user has clothes stored at their grandmother's house and finds visiting her complex due to a feud with their father.
- The preferred day to visit is Sunday, as Saturdays are considered too stressful.
- The user contemplates bringing their cousin along for support and to facilitate the visit without encountering their father.

### Key Questions/Ponderings
- How can the user avoid seeing their father when visiting their grandmother's house?
- Is there a way to coordinate with the cousin to make the visit more comfortable?

### Suggested Goal(s)
- Retrieve clothes from the grandmother's house without encountering the father.

### Actionable Tasks
- Coordinate with the cousin to plan a visit to the grandmother's house on a Sunday.
- Contact the grandmother to ensure the father will not be present during the visit.
cards.name: Clothes from Grandma
